segments.name: Friends/Sharers
segments.definition: Group of friends or flatmates sharing

segments.name: Mixed/Unspecified
segments.definition: Customers who selected multiple household types (e.g., 'Family' AND 'Couple') or left the field blank. This often indicates multi-generational households, visiting relatives, or survey fatigue.
segments.note: Consider splitting into 'Multi-select' vs 'Unspecified' in future surveys

non_family_summary.insight: Non-families are 54% of orders with equal or higher satisfaction than families

segment_differences.insight: Friends/Sharers highest (88.9%), Single lowest (84.6%) - all within 4.3pp
Couples cite value 11pp more than families (57% vs 46%)
Only families cite child appeal as key driver (31% vs <1% for others)
Friends/Sharers most satisfied with portions (87% vs 77% for families)

vp_consumer_insight.question: Can we remove the families focus and expand to couples/solo/groups?
vp_consumer_insight.answer: Data supports expansion - non-families already 54% of orders with equal/higher satisfaction
evidence: No segment shows dissatisfaction with current offering
vp_consumer_insight.caution: Friends/Sharers sample (n=56) needs larger study before major pivot

limitation: Dish-level orders by segment requires Snowflake join - current data shows segment satisfaction but not what each segment orders
